Adding Users

As an administrator, you can add users from the Server Administration dialog at any time. Normally, a user is added to the All Users group and then moved to one or more additional groups, such as Developers or Testers.

Do not create a user account with the name "StarTeam," as this can cause problems when the command line stcmd server-mode command is used to lock or unlock the server configuration. The command requests a password, even when the user has a blank password or when a password has already been provided.

Note: This function can be performed only for servers that are currently running.

To add a user:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the User Manager shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > User Manager.

    The User Manager dialog opens.

  4. Select All Users from the Groups tree. New users will be initially added to this group. Later, they can be added to additional groups.

  5. To create the new user, do one of the following:

  6. Click New Group button.

  7. Right-click in the Users pane and select New from the context menu.

    8. The New User Properties dialog opens.

  8. Enter the user’s name in the Full Name text box.

  9. (Optional) To enter an e-mail address for the user, enter the address in the E-Mail text box using either of the following formats:

    10. yourname@company.com

    user_friendly_name<yourname@company.com>

    If you leave the E-mail text box blank, the following message displays when you click OK. Attempt to resolve e-mail address?

    • Click Yes to have the application search your address server for an e-mail address. If the application cannot locate an e-mail address for this user, the following message displays. E-mail address cannot be resolved. The user will be excluded from e-mail related operations.
      You will have to manually enter the e-mail address if the application is unable to locate one for the user.

    • Click No if you do not want the user to have an e-mail address.

    Note: If a user's e-mail address is ambiguous or incorrect, your mail application will find it undeliverable.

  10. (Optional) Enter the user’s phone number, voice mail number, pager number, fax phone number, and street address in the appropriate text boxes.

  11. Select the Logon tab.

  12. Enter the name to be entered when the user logs onto the application in the User Name text box.

  13. Select either the Validate through StarTeam Server or Validate through directory service button. The application supports both Microsoft Active Directory and OpenLDAP. For users to be validated against the directory server, the Server must be on a trusted domain in relation to that server. The Enable directory service option must also be selected and the location and port number of the directory server entered on the Directory Service tab of the Server Configuration dialog.

  14. If the user will be validated through the Server:

    • Enter a password for the user in the Password text box.

    • Enter the password again in the Confirm text box.

    Notes: If you are using strong passwords, follow the rules for those passwords. If the minimum length of the password can be zero, you do not have to enter and confirm a password.

  15. If the user will be validated through directory service, enter the user's Distinguished name (unique identifier for a directory service user).

  16. (Optional) Select the Access Policy tab to specify when this user can access the server configuration. Select one of the following option buttons:

    • Access restricted, so the user can access the server configuration any time day or night.

    • Standard five-day work week, so the user can access the server configuration Monday through Friday from 8 A.M. to 5 P.M.

    • Custom access hours, to set one or two time periods per day when the user can or cannot access the Server.

      • Select a day of the week from the Day list box.

      • Select the No access on that day check box to deny access or clear it for that day.

      • Use the From and To boxes to set one or two time periods when access is either allowed or denied.

    If the user’s workstation is not in the same time zone as the computer on which the server configuration is running, select the Adjust for workstation time zone check box and type the number of hours from Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) in the Hours from GMT text box.

  17. Click OK.

To add a user to additional groups:

 

  1. Display the User Manager dialog.

  2. Select the user name from the User list.

  3. Right-click to display the context menu and select Group Membership. The Group Membership dialog appears.

  4. Click the check boxes for the groups to which you want to add this user.

  5. Click OK.

  6. A confirmation message appears. Click OK.

    Remember that a user is implicitly (and automatically) already a member of the current group’s parent groups. You must explicitly add a user to groups that are not parents of the current group.
